result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre L Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 2 with credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
No physical discipline of any child.

Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

**Order/06-11-14**
Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; STRAIGHT TIME, FORTHWITH, with no good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre L Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 2 with credit for 3 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent with Count 1 with credit for 3 days time served.   

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6/27/14.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-No physical dicsipline of any child.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no violent contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no violent contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Molly Marie Schmidt for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea.  Due to court calendar and ADA Torbenson's calendar, matter could not be heard.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.     Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Discovery received by defense counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Confrence in Branch 40 on 2-19-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld
Court is in trial.  Case sent to Branch 4 for preliminary hearing.  rmm

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No VIOLENT Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.J. (10/3/08) OR A.J. (8/26/07).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre L Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Andre L Jones in custody.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
